msContents.summary: Heimskringla.The manuscript contains fragments of Heimskringla. The contents are similar to Kringla, but several parts are omitted, not only in Ólafs saga helga, but also in Sigurðar saga Jórsalafara , Magnússona saga and Magnús saga blinda.

msItem.title: Hákonar saga góða
Hákonar saga Aðalsteinsfóstri
msItem.incipit: s va sem fað ir h ans g er ði

ði u m sumarit
siðan fylcði J arl avellino m ok eg g iaþi R agnfreð t il

msItem.incipit: Otta keis ari for aptr isaxl and iriki sit
msItem.explicit: ok v ar allra hunda bæztr at ti ol afr ha nn le n gi siþ an
msItem.note: This fragment goes from the beginning of chapter 29 to the end of chapter 35.

msItem.incipit: Eir iks drapo Mioc let marg ar sneckior

msItem.incipit: eigi hvat lið þ at v ar . v ar þa
msItem.explicit: en er konungr kom þar sem goðin

v ar æin n k onung r y fir nor egi ept ir andlat m agnus b roður s ins

toco s ynir m agnus k onungs h ann ihin n mesta

inor egi

msItem.title: Magnús saga blinda ok Haralds gilla

msItem.explicit: Ept ir þ at sot t o þ ei r ollo liþino at castalano m ok skipo ðo

msItem.incipit: S igurðr v ar ibarnesko fet t r t il boc ar

msItem.title: Inga saga ok brœðra hans
msItem.explicit: at h ann v ar illa gengr m e þ an h ann lifði

foliation.p: The first 40 columns are numbered 1-40. Foliation in the upper right-hand corner is found on fols 3r , 7r , 9r , 10r , 11r .

collation.p:
9 quires:
I (4 leaves): 1+4, 2+3 conjugate
II (2 leaves): 5+6 conjugate
VI (3 leaves):8+10 conjugate, 9 is a singleton
V (8 leaves): 11+18, 12+17, 13+16, 14+15 conjugate
VI (8 leaves): 19+26, 20+25, 21+24, 22+23
VII(5 leaves): 27+31, 28+29 conjugate, 30 is a singleton
VIII (7 leaves): 32+38, 33+36, 34+35 conjugate, 37 is a singleton
IX (5 leaves): 39+43, 41+42 conjugate 40 is a singleton.

condition.p: The leaves of the codex are blackened and damaged, especially the 10 first leaves because of their former use as bindings. As a result of trimming these 10 leaves are also slightly smaller than the other leaves.

layout.p: The manuscript is written in double columns. The number of lines per column varies from 36 to 38. Rubrics are in red.

decoNote.p: The major initials on fol. 12r (the beginning of Magnús saga góða ) and on fol. 18v are litterae florissae with branches and leaves.
The black pen-flourished majuscules that open each chapter fill two or three lines. They seems to be younger than the text and many of them are extended in the margin.

additions.p: At the bottom of fol. 7v Árni Magnússon has written: þetta blad kom til mïn ur Middlum 1704 in April , and at the bottom of fol. 9r he has written: Utan af qvere fra Sigride Erlendzdottur Olafs sonar p rests ad Melstad

binding.p: The manuscript is bound in a BD-standard binding with black leather spine and leathered cornerpieces. 290 245 62

accMat.p: Árni Magnússon has written some information about the acquisition of fols 1-6 and 8 and 10 on four accompanying slips; their content is given above under acquisition.

provenance.p:
According to Árni Magnússon
fols 1 and 4 and 5-6 served as binding for two books belonging to Jón Guðmundsson , Vicar of Hítardalur or the Priest Oddur . Árni Magnússon tells that it then belonged to some people at Skarð in Skarðsströnd .
fols 2 and 3 served as binding for Eyrbyggja belonging to the clergyman Þórður Jónsson of Hítardalur , the next owner mentioned by Árni Magnússon is Þorsteinn Þórðarson .
Fols 8 and 9 belonged to Árni's father, Magnús Jónsson .

acquisition.p:
Árni Magnússon has provided some information concerning the acquisition of fols 1-6 , 8 and 10 on four accompanying slips.
The note pertaining to fols 1 and 4 reads: Þesse 2 bld feck eg ä Skarde ä Skardzstrnd 1703. og voru þau utanum qver er att hafdi Sr Jon Gudmundson i Hitardal (helldur en n Sr Oddur , eg man þ ad öglgt)
The note pertaining to fols 2-3 reads: Þesse 2 bld voru utanum Eyrbyggiu er Þorsteinn Þordarson feck mi er anno 1686. hver Eyrbyggia komin var fra Sr Þorde Jonssyne i Hitardal
The note pertaining to fols 5 and 6 is the same as the first note.
The note pertaining to fols 8 and 10 reads: þetta blad (i.e. fols 8 and 10 ) var utan um qver er att hafdi fader minn M I S . At the bottom of fol. 7v Árni Magnússon has written: þetta blad kom til mïn ur Middlum 1704 in April
At the bottom of fol. 9r he has written: Utan af qvere fra Sigride Erlendzdottur Olafs sonar p rests ad Melstad
Regarding fols 11-43 no further information is given, but according to Kristian Kålund a brief note on fol. 40v in AM 435 a 4to possibly refers to these leaves: Ur Snorra Sturlu sonar æfe Noregs k onun ga fragment. folio .

source.p: Catalogued 25.08.1999. by EW-J . Parsed 26.07.2000 . Checked 14.04.2001 by MJD . Amended 07.01.2005 by JA .

custEvent.p: During the conservation from 10.02.1970 - 20.02.1970 the manuscript was separated and some brown strips were removed.
During the conservation from 18.02.1971 - 28.05.1971 the leaves were restored and attached to meeting guards. In this period the manuscript was rebound.

surrogates.p:
The manuscript was photographed in 1970; the following copies are kept at The Arnamagnæan Collection:
70 mm, 70mm146.
Black and white prints.

bibl.biblScope: xii, xix-xxiii, xxix, xxxi, xxxii, xxxviii, xxxix, xlii, xliii, liv, 130
